caption: Attribute Dictionary
description: The Attribute Dictionary defines schema attributes and includes references to the events and objects in which they are used.
name: dictionary

content_type.caption: HTTP or SMTP Content Type
content_type.description: The request header that identifies the original media type of the resource (prior to any content encoding applied for sending).

members.caption: Members
members.description: Members of the Group of Endpoints

content.caption: The content of the message
content.description: The content of the MIME part, HTTP request, or HTTP response

content_disposition.caption: Content Disposision
content_disposition.description: The value of the Content-Disposition header of the MIME part

dkim.caption: DKIM Status
dkim.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) status of the email.

dkim_domain.caption: DKIM Domain
dkim_domain.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signing domain of the email.

dmarc.caption: DMARC Status
dmarc.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) status of the email.

dmarc_override.caption: DMARC Override
dmarc_override.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) override action.

dmarc_policy.caption: DMARC Policy
dmarc_policy.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) policy status.

dst_endpoint_group.caption: Destination Endpoint Group
dst_endpoint_group.description: The network destination endpoints if there are multiple.

ip_information.caption: IP Protocol Information
ip_information.description: Additional attributes specific to the IP protocol

network_protocols.caption: Network Protocols
network_protocols.description:
Specifies the protocols observed in the network traffic, along with their corresponding state.

Protocols MUST be listed in low to high order, from outer to inner in terms of packet encapsulation. That is, the protocols in the outer level of the packet, such as IP, MUST be listed first.

The protocol names SHOULD come from the service names defined in the Service Name column of the IANA Service Name and Port Number Registry [Port Numbers]. In cases where there is variance in the name of a network protocol not included in the IANA Registry, content producers should exercise their best judgement, and it is recommended that lowercase names be used for consistency with the IANA registry.

protocol_name.caption: Protocol Name
protocol_name.description:
The name of the Protocol in lowercase.

Examples: ip, tcp, tls, http

protocol_number.caption: Protocol Number
protocol_number.description: A number corresponding to the protocol

receiver_hostname.caption: Sender Host Name
receiver_hostname.description: The host name of the receiving email server.

receiver_ip.caption: Sender IP Address
receiver_ip.description: The IP address of the receiving email server, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

sender_hostname.caption: Sender Host Name
sender_hostname.description: The host name of the sending email server.

sender_ip.caption: Sender IP Address
sender_ip.description: The IP address of the sending email server, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

spf.caption: SPF Status
spf.description: The Sender Policy Framework (SPF) status of the email.

tcp_information.caption: TCP Protocol Information
tcp_information.description: Additional attributes specific to the TCP protocol

ip_protocol_name.caption: Protocol Name
ip_protocol_name.description: The TCP/IP protocol name in lowercase, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). See Protocol Numbers. For example: tcp or udp.

ip_protocol_num.caption: Protocol Number
ip_protocol_num.description: The TCP/IP protocol number, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). Use -1 if the protocol is not defined by IANA. See Protocol Numbers. For example: 6 for TCP and 17 for UDP.

ip_protocol_ver.caption: Protocol Version
ip_protocol_ver.description: The Protocol version, as defined by the event source.

ip_protocol_ver_id.caption: Protocol Version ID
ip_protocol_ver_id.description: The normalized identifier of the Protocol version.

email_auth.caption: Email Authentication
email_auth.description: The SPF, DKIM and DMARC attributes of an email.

email_uid.caption: Email UID
email_uid.description: The unique identifier of the email, used to correlate related email alert and activity events.

src_endpoint_group.caption: Source Endpoint Group
src_endpoint_group.description: The network source endpoint group if there are multiple.

types.caption: Swimlane Data Types
types.description: Swimlane-specific data types. The data type specifies what kind of data a value can have.

turbine_file_t.caption: Turbine File
turbine_file_t.description: Turbine file encoded as an object with a file_name and file UUID attribute
